result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin J Fischer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of probation shall remain the same as conditions of Extended Supervision.

miscConds.notes: If probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant must disclose opiate addiction to any medical providers.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow treatment recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin J Fischer

records.addlTxt: Probation discharged.

Letter received from PF

Def in person & by Atty. William Mayer.  Atty. Peter Cannon appeared for State.  Resolution reached with Defense free to argue on recommendation of condition time.  State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds Defendant guilty on Ct. 1 and orders Ct. 2 dismissed and read in.  Court reviews submissions by Defense.  Argument by counsel.  Statement by Defendant.  Atty. Jeanette Corbett appears for the State (ADA Cannon no longer present)  Court proceeds to sentencing.
